Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course is fundamentally about 'Macroeconomics Analysis', with core topics including 'The Solow growth model', 'New growth theory', and 'Real-business-cycle theory', all central to economic growth.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The curriculum includes 'New growth theory', which explicitly models technological progress and innovation as the primary engines of long-run economic growth, a key aspect of this SDG.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: The course covers the 'overlapping-generations model', which can be used to analyze intergenerational equity, but the description does not explicitly focus on inequality or distributional outcomes.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: The 'Infinite-horizon and overlapping-generations model' analyzes consumption patterns over time, but there is no mention of sustainability or responsible consumption.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: The course covers 'Inflation and monetary policy', which is administered by central banks—key economic institutions. It also aims to build 'policy analysis ability'.
